name: DoubleTree by Hilton Savannah Historic District

reviews.text: The location is fabulous - nearly everything within walking distance. City Market across the street, River Street 2 blocks away, Forsyth Park a nice stroll away (approx. 8 blocks). Staff was very friendly, rooms clean and large. We were all very happy with the location and hotel.
reviews.title: Great location adjacent to City Market, nice rooms and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was planning a trip to Savannah for my 27th birthday, and I wanted to stay at a nice bed and breakfast. My sister works for Hilton's Corporate Offices and she was able to get me an AMAZING friends and family rate for this Doubletree, so my husband and I decided to just stay at a chain hotel instead of a bed and breakfast. I had really high expectations for this place, since I sort of had my heart set on a bed and breakfast. The hotel came through, 10 times better than I could have hoped!
reviews.title: Couldn't have been any better!

reviews.text: We were scheduled Wednesday and Thursday, only 2 nights. Check in was 4PM but we arrived in Savannah pretty early Wednesday morning. After visiiting Fort Pulaski and the Lighthouse on Tybee (visit those places, by the way. Especially the lighthouse!), it was only 2PM and we were already exhausted from sight-seeing! I called the hotel, just to ask them to (if at all possible) have our room ready a little early. Mariah told me that my room was ready now, and I was more than welcome to come on in. I told her "wow, I wasnt expecting that! What if we needed a smoking room instead? How long is the wait?" Again, her answer was "come on in!". No charge for checking in 2 hours early! And the warm cookie, its no joke!
reviews.title: Good choice for Savannah

reviews.text: Valet was really easy to figure out upon check-in. The first valet guy was awesome, but I cant remember his name (sorry, bro). Everyone else we met on the valet team was great, too. Very friendly and charismatic guys, yet professional when they need to be. Valet prices were down to $15/night unlimited access for this slower season, but I'd have no problem paying $25/night for their services (plus tips. please tip, people!). We only used the car once during our stay, to go to Bonaventure. The hotel location is perfect, we just walked everywhere, and enjoyed doing it.
reviews.title: North side rooms (facing West Bay Street) are VERY loud

reviews.text: Even though we had a smoking room, the room was very clean, and didnt stink. It smelled a little like cigarettes because its a smoking room (hello. and us smokers dont mind that. if you do mind it, get a non-smoking room). But you could tell the room was clean! You can go online and request more towels or pillows, or whatever you need after you make your reservation, but had plenty of towels and pillows. We wanted privacy. Since we were only there for 2 nights, we didnt want housekeeping (or anyone else) bothering us. We kept the DO NOT DISTURB sign up, and they respected it. The hotel is quiet. You can hear light traffic on Bay St at night, but it didn't keep us awake (our room was on Bay St. Light sleepers migth wanna request a room on the pool side). Bed was so comfortable! Even my husbamd with all his back problems was a little sad that he had to say goodbye to that bed when we were leaving. Gym looked great but I had no use for a gym during my birthday vacation....come on, now! Checked out the pool, it is heated! We just ran out of time to use it. We wished we had planned a 3 night stay instead of a 2 night stay! Because we skipped out on having house keeping come in, I called the front desk and requested more towels. They brought them up right away, within 10 minutes of making the call. Everyone was so nice.
reviews.title: Savannah's Best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at the Doubletree in Savannah 3 times. The valet staff is always very professional and very helpful. The rooms are somewhat dated but are still considered quite nice. I recommend the Doubletree
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: This has always been my choice in Savannah. I usually visit in January and July although last year had to skip July due to a family illness.
reviews.title: Don't Valet here! My favorite hotel for years has let me down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived Friday January 14. Already knowing the valet charge had SKYROCKETED from $10 last January to an outrageous $25 I refused valet service and parked in the public underground garage at Ellis Square just a block away. $12 for 48 hours, take THAT Doubletree!
reviews.title: highly recommended

reviews.text: Emmett at the valet station was wonderful and took our luggage to our room and fetched us ice while we checked in.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The front desk clerk was bored and not friendly. No offer of cookies, we had to ask. I was not recognized as a returning guest or a Honors Gold member. No free bottled water at this hotel like I always get elsewhere. I received an email asking if I wanted a free upgrade to a jacuzzi room if available. I was informed they don't even have those kind of rooms so why the email?
reviews.title: Great location, great value, great comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed this hotel and found the location perfect for exploring historic Savannah. The staff was great, especially the front desk and the concierge. We got a good package deal online, so the valet parking was not as expensive and the breakfast was also included. I would love to have had a fridge and microwave but overall it was a good value.
reviews.title: Nice peopole, good location

reviews.text: Priced at 25.00 per night, I was not happy with this addition to my bill..BUT I never had such great service at any hotel. Prompt, cheerful the group of people making up this staff was exceptional!!! The hotel was fine, rooms a nice size tastefully furnished, but basic..no fridg etc. The coffee maker area was not equipped with a light ...The only problem we ran into was the horrible morning buffet. The selections were not refilled on a prompt basis. The food quality was less than expected, and it was not cheap. Our server took 15 minutes to even take our drink order. I guess she was to busy walking around as their were very few diners. Skip it would be my best advise. Other than that it was fine, if you need a room..Market Area was within walking distance..
reviews.title: Valet Service, one of the best..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I thought this trip was going to be a nice trip to Savannah for a friends wedding. Well it started out that my boyfriend not feeling well with a 102 fever but insisted that we go.
reviews.title: Shockingly Bad....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So when we drive up the Valley Service personal greeted me and informed me that they were the only ones who could park the car and there was a $25.00 fee. I am uneasy letting someone I JUST met drive my car ANYWHERE. So I left my sick boyfriend in the car. I then went in to check in while during the check in process they asked if I was having the Valley Service park my car, I then told them that the guy told me I had no choice, they told me that I had a choice but there were not free parking lots. I had a choice to park my car behind the building for $10.00 a day but it was not insured if something happened to my car VS the hotel parking my car and if anything happened they would be liable for it. So I was aggravated at this point and said just do it. Other than that the check in process was smooth.
reviews.title: Very Nice!!

reviews.text: I proceeded to go to the floor that our room was located on, I knew it was a bad sign when I arrived to the room; started to put the room key and maintenance opened the door and walked out. He said that he was through with the room but housekeeping needed to come wipe down the bathroom. Upon entering the room it was a STRONG smell of cigarette smoke and house keeping came in and strictly wiped down the bathroom. I was extremely aggravated at this point but the wedding was at 5 PM at this point it was 4 PM.
reviews.title: Very Nice Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent our 25th Anniversary at this hotel and chose it as the venue for our party. The staff was extremely friendly and very accommodating to all our requests. They took a lot of extra time making sure we had use of all the facilities including the front lounge for several of our gatherings. We had a total of 5 rooms at this Doubletree and all of our guests had a wonderful experience with their rooms. Breakfast was better than average for Doubletree and the wait staff made a large table available for all of us to eat together in the morning. The hotel had larger rooms available for our use which we did not take advantage of. The chef made a non-menu item for us of a cheese selection and hard salami platter along with toasted baguette slices drizzled with olive oil and parmesan to go along with our bottles of wine. Savannah itself is a wonderful place to visit. The Doubletree Historic District location is an easy walk to most of the downtown. Their parking staff was very friendly and had no issues with the ins and outs for the many trips to the airport to pick up and drop off our guests. We booked rooms way in advance with breakfast and parking included so in addition to our event, we had a great value for our dollar. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Savannah.
reviews.title: Very Accommodating
Fairly typical Doubletree Hotel, Exactly as I expected
reviews.text: I booked my stay for early December 2010 directly with the hotel, at rack rates, for a business meeting. The hotel was very nicely decorated, and perfectly comfortable. Bedding clean and comfortable, climate control worked well, Bathroom was well lighted and had standard Doubletree amenities, including clean fluffy towels. Room was spacious and the TV worked well. Internet was available though I did not use it.

My only complaint was the hammering on the floor above me from midnight to 1am, it sounded like they were replacing the baseboards or installing cabinets or something! But since I had my TV pretty loud, I can't say I was actually trying to sleep, and it seemed that when I turned the TV off, they stopped the hammering. Perhaps coincidence, or perhaps conscientious workmen.
reviews.title: Need to give it another shot

reviews.text: Business meeting facilities were adequate and acceptable. Frankly, I forgot I was in a hotel and spend the whole of two days in business conferences, and that speaks to the hotel having met our needs exactly--to the extent we could be extremely productive.
reviews.title: Horrible Service

reviews.text: Housekeeping was invisible but effective. I enjoyed my stay, and would stay again.
reviews.title: Conrad Hilton must be displeased!

description: Feel valued and cared for at DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Savannah Historic District, and enjoy a variety of special comforts and thoughtful amenities, including a freshly baked, warm DoubleTree chocolate chip cookie on arrival. Set in the heart of Savannah’s Historic District, just 20 minutes from Savannah International Airport, this Savannah hotel is positioned next to Savannah City Market and just one walking block from the iconic River Street. Explore Savannah’s nearby attractions and shopping as you step out the front door and immerse yourself in the historic city.Unwind in a spacious guest room or choose a suite and relax with a separate living space, a microwave and refrigerator. Indulge with delicious, innovative cuisine at Savannah restaurant, John Ryan’s Bistro or sip on evening drinks at John Ryan’s Pub. Bathe in the summer sun on this Savannah hotel’s pool deck or plunge into the hotel’s outdoor heated pool and whirlpool.Enjoy a comfortable and professional setting to catch up on work in the 24-hour business center and benefit from complimentary WiFi throughout the hotel. Host a meeting in one of seven fully equipped meeting spaces and let us help you with the planning. Hold a corporate meeting in the modern boardroom or celebrate your next special event for up to 150 guests in our function rooms.
